meanings.definition: A person who believes in immanence, especially in a religious or philosophical context.
meanings.sent1: The immanentist found peace in the idea of immanence within nature.
meanings.sent2: The immanentist community gathered to discuss their shared beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The immanentist joked that even the clouds seemed immanentist today.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an immanentist temple, filled with thoughts of interconnectedness.
meanings.sent5: The immanentist's heart beat in rhythm with the immanence of the universe.

meanings.definition: Relating to the belief in immanence.
meanings.sent1: The immanentist philosophy emphasized the immanence of all things.
meanings.sent2: She had an immanentist perspective that shaped her view of the world.
meanings.sent3: The immanentist painting seemed to breathe life into the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The immanentist sunset painted the sky with hues of interconnectedness.
meanings.sent5: His immanentist approach to music made every note resonate with unity.
